conclusion: Understand the setup of the problem with a point light source, a ball thrown vertically, and initial conditions.
Determine the ball's vertical motion using the equation y(t) = v_0 t - (1/2) g t^2.
The shadow of the ball on the wall moves horizontally.
The horizontal distance from the light source to the wall is d.
Use similar triangles to relate the shadow's position x(t) to the ball's height y(t).
Relate the ball's height to the shadow's position using x(t) = (d/h) y(t).
At t = 0, the ball is at the midpoint, so y(0) = 0.
Determine the initial velocity of the shadow using the derivative of x(t) with respect to time.
Calculate the initial velocity of the shadow as (d/h) v_0.
Conclude that the initial velocity of the shadow is v_0.
